references.paper_title: The tunnel effect: Building data representations in deep neural networks
references.reason: This paper introduces the tunnel effect hypothesis, which is the central focus of the current study.

references.paper_title: Feature learning in deep classifiers through intermediate neural collapse
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of intermediate neural collapse, a phenomenon closely related to the tunnel effect.

references.paper_title: Does progress on ImageNet transfer to real-world datasets?
references.reason: This paper investigates the transferability of ImageNet-trained models to real-world datasets, a topic highly relevant to the study of out-of-distribution generalization.

references.paper_title: Do ImageNet classifiers generalize to ImageNet?
references.reason: This paper challenges the common assumption that ImageNet-trained models generalize well to unseen data, directly relating to the study of OOD generalization.

references.paper_title: Accuracy on the line: on the strong correlation between out-of-distribution and in-distribution generalization
references.reason: This paper investigates the correlation between in-distribution and out-of-distribution generalization performance, which is crucial for understanding the tunnel effect.
